title: Messages deleted/missing after compacting
content:
First off, I'd like to thank Wayne Mery and david for their responses to my query - it's pretty awesome that folks even bother to help these days, and I'm grateful.

To answer Wayne's query, all my folders, sub-folders, and sub-sub-folders are intact - just simply zero saved e-mails in any of them (I did check each one).

david - your info was most helpful, as I once was pretty confident in my Windows 'skillset', but I switched to Linux over 20 years ago, so the process will be a bit different - am working on that, and hoping some of the Endeavor OS forums can help me translate your directions.

I'm convinced these e-mails still exist somewhere in the 'ether', so there must be a way to retrieve them and restore them (after which - lesson learned - I will move them to files on my main backup drives).

While the problem isn't solved, I really want to thank you both again for coming to my aid - it is truly most appreciated! John Van Epps (JVE)
creator: johnvanepps0312

title: upgrade to Thunderbird Release failed to "port" two of five email accounts
content: Upon following the instructions to upgrade from the ESR version to the Thunderbird version, I am left with two email accounts that are devoid of messages. Additionally, tabs at the top now have no title or content. Recommendations?
creator: incredibill

title: Download attachment filenames
content:
Thunderbird 128.11.0 ESR 64 bit on Windows 10 PC

When I take pics on my Droid phone and e-mail them as attachments using Yahoo! e-mail on my phone to my Thunderbird account on my PC I use at home, the filenames change.

They used to show up with the filenames as 'date stamps', ie 20250527_01433 or something like that, which is what they show up as on my phone - which is normal, but NOW they download to my PC as a sequential filename such as 1000007145 - something that makes no sense.

You can look at the Properties of the pics and those show the date/time taken, but it doesn't help me when I am trying to easily track pics taken by date/time.

Yes, I can manually change the filenames once I save them - which is a real PITA, but what changed? Is there some setting somewhere that got changed with an automatic update that I can't find?

How can I get back to having them download to my PC using the date/time stamp as filenames?

Any help is appreciated.

Fred
creator: fredman11

title: Text runs off right edge of screen when I compose
content:
When I compose a message in Thunderbird the text runs off the right edge of the screen. If I keep typing blind eventually the text will wrap but some text will still not be visible.

Is there a way to set Thunderbird to recognize the width of my monitor (slightly narrower than standard) or some other remedy?

After I finish I can zoom out and see what was hidden but of I type at that level of zoom the same thing will happen again.

Thanks.

title: combined inbox inThunderbird
content: I used to use Mailspring and loved it's combined inbox. Incoming messages for both of my email accounts would show in a combined inbox. I like Thunderbird and wish it had a combined inbox.Do we think it will ever happen?
creator: experience.engine

title: On Start up Thunderbird locks up with "Not responding" if anything is selected
content: Thunderbird has become a pain now for a number of months- regardless of any updates. On first start up if I click on anything on Thunderbird before ALL email accounts have completely finished downloading, Thunderbird locks up and displays not responding on the top of the screen. I have to wait ten minutes and longer before I can start reading a email until every email on every email account has finished downloading. When a site says it is sending a verification email - before I can see that email when I start Thunderbird - the verification email needs to be resent because it has run out of time. This never happened a year ago - now it is daily! I don't know what Mozilla is doing to Thunderbird but it is now highly unreliable! If it was not the only free email client software I would have dumped it by now. Why is it doing this?
creator: rrambrose

title: How can I set Thunderbird to open on a specific email account?
content:
Unless I shut down Thunderbird on my main email account, it will open with the last email account read. There must be a way to set this to open every time on a specific email account but I am yet to find out how to do that. For example - email account FY@gmail.com is what I want to show when Thunderbird starts - but unless this email account was the last read before it was shut down the last time - it only opens on the account last read before it was last shut down.

How to set this to a specific account when Thunderbird opens every time?
creator: rrambrose

title: Can't setup OAuth gmail account
content:
I'm setting up a gmail workspace account. I know that imap is enabled and that authentication should work through oauth2. That's what I configure and TB confirms that it can connect to the account during creation widget.

I click continue, and a new window opens which contains a site from Google asking if I confirm that TB can access my account. I click on allow, and the content in that popup disappears, but the popup remains open. Just with a blank screen.

I've tried several times. Cookies and JavaScript are allowed and enabled.

What else could be wrong here?

title: Thunderbird 139: Reply composer uses black text on black background with dark theme
content:
Hello,

Since updating to Thunderbird 139, I’ve encountered a persistent issue with the dark theme in the reply composer. When replying to HTML messages, the text appears black on a dark background, making it nearly unreadable.

This issue did not occur in Thunderbird 138 — nothing else changed on my system except the automatic update.

Here’s what I’ve tried:

- Verified that toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets is set to true in about:config.

- Created and edited a userContent.css file inside the active profile folder.

- Used various CSS rules targeting messengercompose.xhtml to override text and background colors (e.g. forcing color: #ddd and background-color: #000).

-Tried resetting composition preferences like msgcompose.background_color and msgcompose.text_color in prefs.js.

- Set Thunderbird to use plain text composition, which works — but this is only a temporary workaround.

- Ensured that no conflicting extensions (e.g. DeepDark) are enabled.

-Confirmed the issue happens even with a clean profile. - Manually set the default text and background colors to white on black in the composition settings — but replies still render with black text on black background.

The problem seems to be that Thunderbird 139 overrides the user-defined dark theme or does not apply CSS properly in replies.

Is this a known regression? Is there any workaround to enforce dark-compatible colors in HTML reply composition without switching to plain text?

Thanks for your help.

Daniele
creator: danielebalit1
